chapter.title: Quotas
chapter.para: There are two ways to handle quotas in PMB. Advanced quota management is enabled if the parameter pmb.quotas_avances is set to 1 in the Administration > Tools > parameters.

When a circulation quota is reached, an alert warns the staff at the issue counter giving her/him the option, as the case may be, to force the loan. For more details, read the PMB user guide, Cirulation chapter.

sect1.title: If Advanced Quota Management is not enabled
sect1.para: If advanced quota management is not enabled, you will not see "quotas" in the menu.
In this case, only the loan period and the hold duration per media type can be set. For more details, see .

sect1.title: Quotas : duration, quantity and types
sect1.para: In PMB, there is two types of quotas, they correspond either to period or to quantity or number of items. Quotas may be set according to various types.

sect2.title: Period
sect2.para: Quotas linked to period work all in the same way : a default value (14 see below) is used if no particular specified value is applicable.

This value is set in General parameters in the default value fields by XXX if left unspecified. It is a period given in days. If calendar is not enabled in General parameters and the opening days of the library are not set accordingly PMB sees all seven days of the week equally. Thus Monday will be counted as one day just like Sunday.

figure.title: Quotas : default value for a duration quota in PMB

sect2.title: Quantity
sect2.para: Quotas linked to quantity work all in the same way : a default value is used if no particular specified value is applicable.

This value is defined in General parameters in the default value fields by XXX if left unspecified. This value points to the number of works, serials or holds corresponding to only ONE type of document. Quotas linked to quantity also have a field to enter the maximum quota allowed. This maximum represents the absolute quota across works, serials or holds collectively. If the default value is set at 5 and no other value is entered, the reader will have the right to hold, borrow 5 CDs and 5 books all at the same time. If the maximum is set at 7, he will be able to have 7 works only, of which a maximum of 5 CDs or 5 books.

figure.title: Quotas : default values for quantity linked quotas in PMB

sect2.title: Types of quotas
sect2.para: There are five types of quotas linked to quantity or period:

listitem.para: A quota may be set for each borrower category in the column "Number of items". To delete a quota, clear the value entered in the check box. Warning, 0 does not mean no quota at all, but one whose value is set to 0, that is, loan not allowed.

You may authorize (or not) override quota for each of the readers categories. If a quota is reached by one reader in a particular category, the librarian may then authorize a loan issue, that is, override the stop loan directive.
A quota may be set for each type of document. It works exactly like quotas by readers categories Quotas by media types
by Readers categories and by Media types

Here you may cross Readers categories with Media types to refine your loans policy. Quotas are displayed in the form of a table sub-listing all the media types under each Readers category. Quotas by Readers categories and by Media types
Functions exactly like by Readers categories, but individually for every reader of your library. Quotas by individual readers
by Media types and by Individual readers
Functions exactly like by Readers categories and by Media types, but individually for every reader of your library. Quotas by individual Readers and by Media types

sect2.para: Example. By defining a quota linked to Number of items by Readers categories and by Media types, you could thus grant students the right to borrow 2 CD audio.

sect2.title: number of items
sect2.para: We are talking here about defining the number of items that can be borrowed simultaneously.

sect2.title: loan period
sect2.para: This comes under loans management (advanced) relating to loan period of copies of works.

There are five types of quotas by loan period : by Readers categories, by Media types, by Readers categories and by Media types, by Individual readers, and finally by Media types and by Individual readers.

sect2.title: number of holds
sect2.para: This refers to loans management relating to the number of items (except serials) that can be placed on hold simultaneously.

sect2.title: hold duration
sect2.para: This comes under loans management (advanced) relating to duration of hold for works (except serials).

sect2.title: number of serials holds
sect2.para: This refers to loans management relating to the number of items (serials only) that can be placed on hold simultaneously.

sect2.title: serials hold duration
sect2.para: This comes under loans management (advanced) relating to duration of hold for serials.

sect1.title: In case of conflict
sect1.para: In addition to the default values (see further up Quotas : period, quantity and types), the general parameters allow you to choose how to resolve conflicts between quotas. Since you can define quotas by individual readers and by categories as well, you will have to decide which one has precedence over the other.

In case of conflict between several quotas, you can choose among Take the largest (full authorization policy) Take the smallest(full restriction policy), Take the default value (if both values clash, it's the default value that be used to resolve the conflict), enfin de Process according to a specified directive the various quotas.
If you choose to retain this option, you can use list-down menus to indicate the order of precedence of your types of quotas.
You may also leave it to your staff at the issue counter to decide in principle whether to authorize a loan thus overriding the stop directive.

sect1.title: Defining a quota
sect1.para: Let's take an example. In our library, children are allowed three items of which a maximum of two books, two items from the Deparmental Lending Library, one CD audio, one video recording. For a school project the children may on request be allowed more than two items from the Deparmental Lending Library (forcing the loan directive for this type of document and the total number of items allowed at the same time).

step.para: On the Administration tab, click on Quotas in the side menu
Next click on Number of items quota
Click on quota type by Readers categories
For the category Children, enter 2 for number of items, and clear Override quota
Click on quota type by Readers categories and by Media types.
For the category Children, enter 2 for number of items Book, and clear Override quota
Again for the category Children, enter 2 for number of items BDP items, and tick No override
Once again for the category Children, enter 1 for number of items CD Audio and 1 for number of items Video recording, and tick No override
Your quotas are now defined. Vous may eventually customize the general parameter to suit your needs.
